intro: Hieracium euprepes var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, setting it apart from other Hieracium species.
